m_szDocTitle: London hydrogen network project breaks distance records for FCEVs | Fleet World
m_szDocSumamry: News London hydrogen network project breaks distance records for FCEVs The new FCEV distance records were set by the London Hydrogen Network Expansion project in a Hydrogen ix35 Fuel Cell car on the M25. The government-backed London Hydrogen Network Expansion project (LHNE) has set two new distance records for hydrogen fuel cell electric vehicles (FCEVs). The partners of the project have broken the record for the longest journey in the UK on a single tank of hydrogen, travelling 400 miles, and have also broken the longest continuous journey for an FCEV by travelling 6,096 miles over the course
